column5: description
Chromosome/Contig
Begin of feature (0 based - half open)
End of feature (0 based - half open)
Type of feature (snp,del,ins,...)
Reference sequence, can be a number for large features
Alternative sequence, can be a number for large features
name of feature
Quality score of feature
Filter value
allele present on first chromosome/haplotype
allele present on second chromosome/haplotype
sequenced status: v = variant, r = reference (i.e. not this variant), u = unsequenced
Zygosity status: m = homozygous, t = heterozygous, r = reference, o = other variant, c = compound, i.e. genotype has this variant and other variant
Phased status: 0 if not phased, other integer if phased
Genotypes
Genotype Quality
Empirically calibrated genotype quality score for variant sites, otherwise minimum of {Genotype quality assuming variant position,Genotype quality assuming non-variant position}
Filtered basecall depth used for site genotyping. In a non-variant multi-site block this value represents the average of all sites in the block.
Basecalls filtered from input prior to site genotyping. In a non-variant multi-site block this value represents the average of all sites in the block.
Minimum filtered basecall depth used for site genotyping within a non-variant multi-site block

reference only value of: Allelic depths for the ref and alt alleles in the order listed. For indels this value only includes reads which confidently support each allele (posterior prob 0.51 or higher that read contains indicated allele vs all other intersecting indel alleles)

alleles only values of: Allelic depths for the ref and alt alleles in the order listed. For indels this value only includes reads which confidently support each allele (posterior prob 0.51 or higher that read contains indicated allele vs all other intersecting indel alleles)
Allelic depths on the forward strand
Allelic depths on the reverse strand
Sample filter, 'PASS' indicates that all filters have passed for this sample
Read depth associated with indel, taken from the site preceding the indel
Normalized, Phred-scaled likelihoods for genotypes as defined in the VCF specification
Phase set identifier
Sample site strand bias

Non-variant multi-site block. Non-variant blocks are defined independently for each sample. All sites in such a block are constrained to be non-variant, have the same filter value, and have sample values {GQX,DP,DPF} in range [x,y], y <= max(x+3,(x*1.3)).
SNV contextual homopolymer length
CIGAR alignment for each alternate indel allele
Smallest repeating sequence unit extended or contracted in the indel allele relative to the reference. RUs are not reported if longer than 20 bases
Number of times RU is repeated in reference
Number of times RU is repeated in indel allele
RMS of mapping quality

column3: Indel genotypes from two or more loci conflict in at least one sample
Site is filtered due to an overlapping indel call filter
Locus GQX is below threshold or not present
The fraction of basecalls filtered out at a site is greater than 0.4
Sample SNV strand bias value (SB) exceeds 10
Locus depth is greater than 3x the mean chromosome depth
Locus contains forcedGT input alleles which could not be genotyped
Genotype call from variant caller not consistent with chromosome ploidy
No samples at this locus pass all sample filters and have a variant genotype
